title: Cassiopeia did not receive any type of mana compesation buff.
body:
She is one of the most mana hungry champs in league, almost every mage received more base mana and more mana regen on the pbe, why was Cassiopeia overlooked? AGAIN!

Edit 1: Pbe update just went out and guess what? No Cassiopeia change nor Cassiopeia skin, I know this is different, but for God sake, when is she going to get a new skin? The Cassiopeia hate is so ridiculous, incredible...

Reading all of this is very disturbing. I was hoping to buy Cassiopeia because I was interested in her mechanics and she'd be my first dedicated mage/mid lane champ. 

I'll probably buy her anyway, but all this talk what state she's in makes me really apprehensive.

I like Cass, but she's not a good mid to start with.  Think of her like an AP jinx.  Great when protected, dead on her own.  Cass has high burst damage, but no utility or escape except for her ult.  Same reason Malz hasn't really been playable in a long time.

Both are, at best, team comp dependent and very situational picks that are highlly susceptible to assassins and decent ganking junglers.
In bronze-silver, Malz is FREELO in most cases.

Malzahar is pretty freelo at all ranks. He consistently has one of the highest solo queue win rates out of all mid laners. It's unfortunate that he has less than a 4% play rate, but his win rate only rises the more someone plays him, and that's good news for mains.

He preys on *lone* players. His 1v1 threat utterly dominates, and one spell rotation can and will shred anything from squishies to hypertanks. However, he's focused entirely on single target damage. This alone hurts his viability against a coordinated team greatly, and it's why he doesn't ever need nerfs. One player fighting on their own will almost definitely get their sorry ass beat, but a *team* will destroy him completely.

In that case I can certainly wait on buying her. I mostly play support and am looking to branch out a bit before I get too comfortable. I'll look at other champs in the meantime, maybe Karthus or Viktor. 

Unless I can play her support. That'd be the day!

#Rito Logic

"Mana problems"

If Twin Fang kills the target, it refunds its mana cost (+ 1.5% maximum mana).

If the target is Poison icon poisoned, Twin Fang's cooldown is reduced to a static 0.5 seconds.


You mean, Free mana machine?

Yes, mana problems. Cass is forced to rush a Tear ffs.

Twin Fang mana refund is only useful when you are farming minions.

It doesn't help you when you want to trade, harass, or if you actually want to win your lane. Not to mention if you want to take objectives with your team.

So? Almost any other AP mid doesnt have free mana when farming, so cassio can easily farm up without losing any mana. and its not like mana items are bad anyway. can get a tear and easily farm it up with low cd skills while keeping mana high cuz ur farming and then u'll be a lategame carry in no time.

Lissandra's mana regen was left to rot just like Cassiopeia's, because she gets one free spellcast every 18 seconds (reduced by 1 second for every enemy CCed by her spells). These are completely different reasons.

If you wanted to compare Cassiopeia to another champion with a mana refund, then let me enlighten you to {{champion:90}}, another victim left without mana or regen buffs. Just like Cassiopeia, Malzahar's mana refund mechanic is tied to his ability to CS efficiently with the bounce from Malefic Visions, and using his spells to harass can leave him high and dry even faster than the gorgon just if you're not lucky with minion positioning, let alone messing up a combo.

Totally agree with Malzahar, I've played him before and quite a lot during Season 3 when I first started League cause he was just awesome, spell and thematic-wise. That being said, I've never ran into THAT many mana issues because with any mage except Lissandra I'm flippin' Scrooge McDuck. Oh and Ziggs. I eat Ziggs mana bar faster than most people would kill for a Klondike bar.

This all being said, I guess it's  up to individual playstyle. I never classified Malz as someone you should go ham with until later on when your mana pool is larger, but eh that's just me :|
